clinical_study.brief_title: Patient Aligned Care Team (PACT) Intensive Management (PIM) Project
clinical_study.official_title: Patient Aligned Care Team (PACT) Intensive Management (PIM) Project

lead_sponsor.agency: Veteran Affairs Office of Patient Care Services

collaborator.agency: VA Office of Research and Development
VA Palo Alto Health Care System

clinical_study.source: Veteran Affairs Office of Patient Care Services

brief_summary.textblock:
Purpose: Implement a Patient Aligned Care Team (PACT) model that identifies and proactively manages Veterans at the highest risk for hospital admission and death while they are still in the ambulatory care setting.
Goal:
- Reduce emergency department and urgent care utilization, hospitalization, and mortality in complex, high risk patients
- Improve Veteran and staff satisfaction
Objectives:
- Maintain the patient in the home setting as much as possible
- Secure appropriate home environment to facilitate health and well-being
- Utilize comprehensive team-based care
- Engage appropriate Veteran Health Administration (VHA) programs to provide interdisciplinary, coordinated, and timely management of complex medical issues

primary_outcome.description: Total costs of VA care, including inpatient, outpatient, pharmacy and fee-basis services.

secondary_outcome.description: VA central repository administrative data will be analyzed to calculate utilization of hospital, emergency and outpatient primary and specialty care. This information will be electronically abstracted through the VA central repository administrative data center

other_outcome.description: Existing VA administrative data on both intervention and control sample will be analyzed to calculate utilization of hospital, emergency and outpatient primary and specialty care. This data will be electronically abstracted through the VA central repository administrative data center.

VA administrative data on the time and type of initial assessment will be abstracted for both intervention and control groups. Specifically the date of screening assessment and the type of assessment utilized (i.e. chart review or patient visit) will assessed. This data will be electronically abstracted through the VA central repository administrative data center.

It will look at patient PIM enrollment data by utilizing central repository administrative data. The data will be electronically abstracted through the VA central repository administrative data center.

Patient report on their physical, social, and mental functional status is routinely collected as part of their medical visit. The data will be abstracted through the VA central repository administrative data.
Patient assessment of their quality of life collected as part of their medical care. This information will be electronically abstracted through the VA central repository administrative data center.

Patient assessment of mental health and physical health symptom burden is routinely collected as part of their care and documented in their medical record. This data will be electronically abstracted through the VA central repository administrative data center.
Information about implementation barriers and facilitators, feasibility, and sustainability will be obtained through two waves of key stakeholder interviews, including QII staff and facility leaders

arm_group.description: The intervention is the PACT Intensive Management Program (PIM) which provides intensive interdisciplinary care planning, care coordination, patient self-management support, and tailored goal setting based on patient needs and preferences, and additional care management services.
High-Risk patients receiving care in PACT.
